item.description:
Recently got this great suggestion from another member and thought to get it on the calendar.  October 14th looks a little slower than usual for Social Fun events, so hope this is a good day for a smaller group to take in some local foliage. We can then spend some time reflecting on the colors over a beer and pub food at one of Boston's most famous landmark's, Doyle's Cafe, in JP.

Let's meet at 12:30 inside the main gate entrance of the Arboretum, in front of the Hunnewell Visitor Center.  I will have a Social Fun Meetup sign so look for that as well. There is a tour at 1:00 which we can do (no registration required) and if that looks too crowded, we can just head out on our own and explore via the arboretum map for 90 minutes or so.  Pretty basic and a lot of fun, as long as... if I dare say it... the weather people cooperate. ;)

Arnold Arboretum: 125 Arborway, Boston, MA 02130

Arnold Arboretum at: http://arboretum.harvard.edu/visit/

Doyle's Cafe: 3484 Washington Street  Jamaica Plain, MA 02130 (617) 524-2345

More info about Doyle's Cafe at: http://www.doylescafeboston.com/

Foliage Forecast: http://www.yankeefoliage.com/peak-foliage-forecast-map/

Directions, parking, map: http://arboretum.harvard.edu/visit/hours-services-and-policies/
item.name: Walk the Arnold Arboretum, Beer Talk at Doyle's Cafe
